questions.neutral: Are the lines starting to blur?

hobby.message: Typewriters treating you better than people?
Still folding origami to stay grounded?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fold origami... from scrap forms mostly. It helps me think... quietly.
neutral_answer: Depends what you mean. Lines blur all the time lately.
I fold origami. Paper's harder to come by now with supplies locked down.
Tried making a model during the uproar, couldn't focus.
Kept the beetle simple. Didn't want to stand out.
It’s hard to keep things straight with all these protests going on.
I do origami. Used to calm me down after work.
Tried it yesterday—papers now have BCI warnings printed everywhere.
Not easy to fold when everyone’s staring at wrists.
Miss the quiet before all this started.
I fold complex origami models. Patterns help me compartmentalize the noise.
Last week, tried a beetle at home. The paper was a protest flyer.
Mural talk made it impossible to focus; hands wouldn’t cooperate.
Everything feels exposed... even folding is public now.
Strange what passes for privacy these days.
Lines blur everywhere, hobbies included.
Origami’s my way to—sort—everything, but it doesn’t work lately.
Was folding a Phobos beetle when 'The Ledger' leaked. People kept watching.
Paper was all system print-offs. Couldn't find anything blank.
Used to fold in the office after late audits. Now I feel visible, even here.
Bar’s louder these days. My models end up left behind, untouched.
Funny, stress used to make me fold better. Now, it just ruins the lines.
Feels like even hobbies are flagged, somehow.
I started origami after my first compliance audit. Folding was... silent, private.
Folded a thousand cranes from Directorate memos before they flagged my access.
Last week, tried a beetle model on a protest flyer. Hands wouldn’t steady.
Saw someone staring at my BCI band. Left the beetle on the bar—nobody touched it.
Feels like folding itself is a risk, now that everyone's looking for allegiances.
Used to exchange complex models with a colleague who vanished. Thought making his favorite crane would help. It didn’t.
Models mirror how I feel. Rushed, uneven folds, creased papers. Even patterns blur.
After ‘The Ledger,’ public and private—everything dissolved. Hobbies included.
hobby_answer: Yeah, a couple cranes. Usual distraction.
Not much space for hobbies lately, honestly.
People notice the paper now—especially since the news broke.
Sometimes I just fold them out of habit.
Everything feels... different since The Ledger went public.
I’ve made a few cranes. Harder to focus these days.
Too many eyes on me after the BCI incident.
Been folding from scrap notices, not real paper.
With so many talking about the mural, origami feels exposed.
Even leaving a model behind gets noticed now.
Yes, folded some cranes last night, but it was tense.
Used to relax me, following the mathematics of it.
Now every time I start, someone’s watching—wondering if it means something.
I’ve had to use BCI documents for paper since supplies are flagged.
The bar feels crowded with rumor; folding isn’t private anymore.
People even read into the models, like I’m signaling.
Leaking The Ledger changed everything, even little habits.
Yeah, still folding cranes and beetles, but it’s changed.
Origami helped keep my thoughts ordered, especially with tough patterns.
Now people stare—paper isn’t just paper since the BCI news.
I folded an infraction notice into a beetle after my access died.
That night, the whole bar felt like it was holding its breath.
My hands shook when testimonies were read aloud nearby.
The mural and Ledger made private things public.
Origami feels less like escape, more like exposure lately.
Cranes, beetles, even a tessellated star—I've kept folding anyway.
Origami was structure when everything else was chaos at work.
I started on Directorate forms after my paper stash got flagged post-Ledger.
No one looked twice before the BCI collapse, now every crease feels watched.
Someone whispered my BCI score—no one touched the beetle I left.
The mural made quiet hobbies risky; everyone’s guessing motives now.
I hear fragments about erased people while folding, can't tune it out.
It used to make me invisible, now it's a signal I never meant to send.
Sometimes, I fold anyway—just to remember I still can.
